info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 3 at 3:53PM PDT until June 3 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including southern Los Angeles County.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in isolated locations within the advisory area. Many areas may not experience flooding or even heavy rain. However, pockets of heavy rain will be small in size and numerous in coverage, so road conditions may vary quickly over short distances. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, Torrance, Inglewood, Redondo Beach, Hermosa Beach, Downtown Los Angeles, Manhattan Beach, Rancho Palos Verdes, Culver City, Venice, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Whittier, Santa Monica, Carson and Port of Los Angeles. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING
